intro: Rondeletia febrifuga, commonly known as feverfew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Rondeletia febrifuga is also noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional medicine for treating fever and inflammation.
